newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Volvo March Japan car sales hit record.
newsitem.headline: Volvo March Japan car sales hit record.

text.p: Swedish automotive group AB Volvo said on Wednesday its Japanese car sales increased 14.3 percent to 2,981 cars in March, the largest monthly Volvo sales in the country in 23 years.
"It's a record month," Volvo spokesman Ulf Thorne told Reuters.
So far this year Volvo has sold 6,045 cars in Japan, up nine percent from the corresponding period a year ago.
Sales were boosted by a campaign for the Volvo 850 model and buying ahead of an increase in the Japanese consumption tax to five percent from three percent on April 1.
Volvo's new model S70/V70 has not been introduced in Japan yet.
"It will be launched shortly," Thorne said.
